title: Anecdotal evidence that the melee-only mission is retarded
body:
First off, let me say it's absolutely ridiculous that you only get 5 tokens for finding a whole premade who will agree to play, at best, 5 games without a ranged champion before matching puts them against either another team trying to do the mission or a group of glue eaters for a chance to win.

But I just had a game where the enemy was clearly trying to do the mission (same clan, no ranged), and I lost connection early on.

I came back, my one friend who was premade with me has died 10 times, and my team was only behind one kill and winning in towers. We went on to win the game. 

Melee only is such a stupid mission that it loses a 5v4, even with the assumed-but-untested advantages of having a 5 man premade group, AND both Yi and Nasus for the late game strength.

I'm sorry, I was unaware the conversation was with someone whose view of balance is extremely skewed by their "I'm in bronze because muh team" mentality.
Playing since Season2... Diamond during my more active times... just spare me already...

Personally I think this melee only mission is Riot's way of gaining data for future gameplay changes to make marksmen less universally required and make melee fights more engaging. 

The complaints only prove that something needs to be done for melee champions.

Yeah, my clan played 3 games before we got it, and we lost an inhib even in that win.

My teammates were kind of ragey too (just voice, not chat) because two of them loathe playing melee anything for any reason. I also prefer playing ranged Champs myself. 

It was frustrating, but maybe(?) Not a bad experience in the end because we had accomplished something difficult together.

But you all got less honor for it, too. 

And difficult or not, it's not practical. You could learn tap dancing instead of karate, and it's just as pointless as learning how to hope the enemy is full of players so bad they can't win with a massive advantage in team comp.

It's like they made the mission knowing it was shit, so they only made it worth 5 tokens so you could avoid it at no consequence. It was honestly a lazy idea with bad implementation that Riot knew was awful. The fact this made it live just makes me worry about the quality control at Riot Games when they would knowingly let a poor product through.

Well, I don't think so. 
Without that mission I would have been exactly 5 short of an orb. 

As with all the events so far, they made it so that if you only do the free missions, you can only possibly get 1 free orb. Without those five tokens, you get nothing of value.

It's a terrible idea for a throwaway mission, but it could have been used to their benefit. The event is nearing conclusion, but they waited until now to give out this particular mission. Now people have to struggle to find a 5 man premade if they want their one guaranteed orb. But if this mission had been up since the beginning, not only would people have time to do it, but they'd have time to realize they weren't getting that orb if they didn't complete this mission ; thus have more incentive to purchase the pass. Rito dun fuked up.
